app.repositories.user module¶

class app.repositories.user.UserRepo(db)¶

Bases: object

create(user)¶
The create function creates a new user in the database.

It takes a User object as an argument and returns the newly created user.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • user – Create a new user

Returns:

A new user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

generate_salt()¶

The generate_salt function generates a random string of characters to be used as the salt for hashing passwords. The function uses the os module’s urandom function to generate a 16 byte string, which is then converted into hexadecimal format and returned.

Parameters:

self – Represent the instance of the class

Returns:

A random string of 16 bytes

Doc-author:

Trelent

get_by_username(username)¶

The get_by_username function is used to retrieve a user from the database by their username.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • username – Filter the query to find a user with that username

Returns:

The first result of the query

Doc-author:

Trelent

get_user_and_check_pass(username, password)¶
The get_user_and_check_pass function takes in a username and password,

hashes the password with the salt from the database, and compares it to what is stored in the database. If they match, then we return that user.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • username – Query the database for a user with that username

  • password – Check if the password entered by the user is correct

Returns:

A user object if the username and password match

Doc-author:

Trelent

hash_password(password, salt=None) → tuple[str]¶

The hash_password function takes a password and an optional salt as input. If no salt is provided, it generates one using the generate_salt function. It then concatenates the password with the salt and hashes them together using SHA256. The hashed password is returned along with its corresponding hex-encoded salt.

Parameters:

  • self – Refer to the current instance of a class

  • password – Get the password from the user

  • salt – Generate a random salt

Returns:

A tuple of the hashed password and salt

Doc-author:

Trelent

update(user)¶

The update function is used to update a user’s information in the database. It takes in a User object and updates the corresponding entry in the database.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • user – Update the user in the database

Returns:

The create function, which returns the user

Doc-author:

Trelent
